description: Manage routing intent in the virtual hub.

commands.name: az network vhub routing-intent create
commands.summary: Create a routing intent in the virtual hub.
commands.syntax:
az network vhub routing-intent create --name
                                      --resource-group
                                      --vhub
                                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--routing-policies]
examples: az network vhub routing-intent create -n MyRoutingIntent -g MyResourceGroup --vhub MyVirtualHub --routing-policies "[{name:InternetTraffic,destinations:[Internet],next-hop:MyFirewallId},{name:PrivateTrafficPolicy,destinations:[PrivateTraffic],next-hop:MyFirewallId}]"

commands.name: az network vhub routing-intent delete
commands.summary: Delete a routing intent in the virtual hub.
commands.syntax:
az network vhub routing-intent delete [--ids]
                                      [--name]
                                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--resource-group]
                                      [--subscription]
                                      [--vhub]
                                      [--yes]
examples: az network vhub routing-intent delete -n MyRoutingIntent -g MyResourceGroup --vhub MyVirtualHub --yes

commands.name: az network vhub routing-intent list
commands.summary: Retrieve the details of all routing intent resources of the virtual hub.
examples: az network vhub routing-intent list -g MyResourceGroup --vhub MyVirtualHub

commands.name: az network vhub routing-intent show
commands.summary: Retrieve the details of a routing intent.
examples: az network vhub routing-intent show -n MyRoutingIntent -g MyResourceGroup --vhub MyVirtualHub

commands.name: az network vhub routing-intent update
commands.summary: Update a routing intent in the virtual hub.
commands.syntax:
az network vhub routing-intent update [--add]
                                      [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--ids]
                                      [--name]
                                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--remove]
                                      [--resource-group]
                                      [--routing-policies]
                                      [--set]
                                      [--subscription]
                                      [--vhub]
examples: az network vhub routing-intent create -n MyRoutingIntent -g MyResourceGroup --vhub MyVirtualHub --routing-policies "[{name:InternetTraffic,destinations:[Internet],next-hop:MyFirewallId}]"

commands.name: az network vhub routing-intent wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
